verses.text: The vision of Isaiah the son of Amoz, which he saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah.
parts: The vision of Isaiah the son of Amoz, which he saw concerning Judah and Jerusalem in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz,

verses.text: Hear, O heavens, and give ear, O earth!For the  has spoken:“I have nourished and brought up children,And they have rebelled against Me;
parts: Hear, O heavens, and give ear, O earth!
“I have nourished and brought up children,
And they have rebelled against Me;

verses.text: The ox knows its ownerAnd the donkey its master’s crib;But Israel does not know,My people do not consider.”

Alas, sinful nation,A people laden with iniquity,A brood of evildoers,Children who are corrupters!They have forsaken the ,They have provoked to angerThe Holy One of Israel,They have turned away backward.
Why should you be stricken again?You will revolt more and more.The whole head is sick,And the whole heart faints.
parts: Why should you be stricken again?
You will revolt more and more.

verses.text: From the sole of the foot even to the head,There is no soundness in it,But wounds and bruises and putrefying sores;They have not been closed or bound up,Or soothed with ointment.
parts: From the sole of the foot even to the head,
wounds and bruises and putrefying sores;
They have not been closed or bound up,

verses.text: Your country is desolate,Your cities are burned with fire;Strangers devour your land in your presence;And it is desolate, as overthrown by strangers.
parts: Strangers devour your land in your presence;

verses.text: So the daughter of Zion is left as a booth in a vineyard,As a hut in a garden of cucumbers,As a besieged city.
parts: So the daughter of Zion is left as a
As a hut in a garden of cucumbers,

verses.text: Unless the  of hostsHad left to us a very small remnant,We would have become like Sodom,We would have been made like Gomorrah.
parts: Had left to us a very small remnant,
We would have become like Sodom,
We would have been made like Gomorrah.

verses.text: Hear the word of the ,You rulers of Sodom;Give ear to the law of our God,You people of Gomorrah:
parts: Give ear to the law of our God,

verses.text: “To what purpose is the multitude of your sacrifices to Me?”Says the .“I have had enough of burnt offerings of ramsAnd the fat of fed cattle.I do not delight in the blood of bulls,Or of lambs or goats.
parts: the multitude of your sacrifices to Me?”
“I have had enough of burnt offerings of rams
And the fat of fed cattle.
I do not delight in the blood of bulls,

verses.text: “When you come to appear before Me,Who has required this from your hand,To trample My courts?
parts: “When you come to appear before Me,
Who has required this from your hand,

verses.text: Bring no more futile sacrifices;Incense is an abomination to Me.The New Moons, the Sabbaths, and the calling of assemblies—I cannot endure iniquity and the sacred meeting.
parts: Incense is an abomination to Me.
The New Moons, the Sabbaths, and the calling of assemblies—
I cannot endure iniquity and the sacred meeting.

verses.text: Your New Moons and your appointed feastsMy soul hates;They are a trouble to Me,I am weary of bearing them.
parts: Your New Moons and your appointed feasts
They are a trouble to Me,

verses.text: When you spread out your hands,I will hide My eyes from you;Even though you make many prayers,I will not hear.Your hands are full of blood.
parts: I will hide My eyes from you;
Even though you make many prayers,

verses.text: “Wash yourselves, make yourselves clean;Put away the evil of your doings from before My eyes.Cease to do evil,
parts: Put away the evil of your doings from before My eyes.

verses.text: Learn to do good;Seek justice,Rebuke the oppressor;Defend the fatherless,Plead for the widow.
“Come now, and let us reason together,”Says the ,“Though your sins are like scarlet,They shall be as white as snow;Though they are red like crimson,They shall be as wool.
parts: “Come now, and let us reason together,”
They shall be as white as snow;

parts: If you are willing and obedient,
You shall eat the good of the land;

verses.text: But if you refuse and rebel,You shall be devoured by the sword”;For the mouth of the  has spoken.
parts: But if you refuse and rebel,
You shall be devoured by the sword”;

verses.text: How the faithful city has become a harlot!It was full of justice;Righteousness lodged in it,But now murderers.
parts: How the faithful city has become a

verses.text: Your silver has become dross,Your wine mixed with water.
Your princes are rebellious,And companions of thieves;Everyone loves bribes,And follows after rewards.They do not defend the fatherless,Nor does the cause of the widow come before them.
parts: They do not defend the fatherless,
Nor does the cause of the widow come before them.

verses.text: Therefore the Lord says,The  of hosts, the Mighty One of Israel,“Ah, I will rid Myself of My adversaries,And take vengeance on My enemies.
parts: of hosts, the Mighty One of Israel,

parts: I will turn My hand against you,
And take away all your alloy.

verse_parts.text: Now let me sing to my Well-beloved
A song of my Beloved regarding His vineyard:My Well-beloved has a vineyard
Lit. In a horn, the son of fatness
He dug it up and cleared out its stones,
And planted it with the choicest vine.
He built a tower in its midst,
But it brought forth wild grapes.
“And now, O inhabitants of Jerusalem and men of Judah,
Judge, please, between Me and My vineyard.
What more could have been done to My vineyard
That I have not done in it?
Did it bring forth wild grapes?
And now, please let Me tell you what I will do to My vineyard:
I will take away its hedge, and it shall be burned;
break down its wall, and it shall be trampled down.
It shall not be pruned or
But there shall come up briers and thorns.
I will also command the clouds
That they rain no rain on it.”
And the men of Judah are His pleasant plant.
He looked for justice, but behold, oppression;
Where they may dwell alone in the midst of the land!
Great and beautiful ones, without inhabitant.
For ten acres of vineyard shall yield one bath,
And a homer of seed shall yield one
Woe to those who rise early in the morning,

Nor consider the operation of His hands.

And prudent in their own sight!

their root will be as rottenness,

And despised the word of the Holy One of Israel.

He will lift up a banner to the nations from afar,

verse_parts.text: came to Ashdod, when Sargon the king of Assyria sent him, and he fought against Ashdod and took it,
spoke by Isaiah the son of Amoz, saying, “Go, and remove the sackcloth from your
body, and take your sandals off your feet.” And he did so, walking naked and barefoot.
said, “Just as My servant Isaiah has walked naked and barefoot three years
a sign and a wonder against Egypt and Ethiopia,
so shall the king of Assyria lead away the Egyptians as prisoners and the Ethiopians as captives, young and old, naked and barefoot, with their buttocks uncovered, to the shame of Egypt.
Then they shall be afraid and ashamed of Ethiopia their expectation and Egypt their glory.
And the inhabitant of this territory will say in that day, ‘Surely such
our expectation, wherever we flee for help to be delivered from the king of Assyria; and how shall we escape?’ ”

verse_parts.text: burden against the Valley of Vision.What ails you now, that you have all gone up to the housetops,
You who are full of noise,
All your rulers have fled together;

Therefore I said, “Look away from me,
Do not labor to comfort me
Because of the plundering of the daughter of my people.”

You also made a reservoir between the two walls
For the water of the old pool.
But you did not look to its Maker,
Nor did you have respect for Him who fashioned it long ago.

Called for weeping and for mourning,
For baldness and for girding with sackcloth.

the shame of your master’s house.

paragraphs_list.text: Listen to the Teaching of God

verse_parts.text: Give ear and hear my voice,
Does the plowman keep plowing all day to sow?
Does he keep turning his soil and breaking the clods?
When he has leveled its surface,
Does he not sow the black cummin
The barley in the appointed place,
For He instructs him in right judgment,
For the black cummin is not threshed with a threshing sledge,
Nor is a cartwheel rolled over the cummin;
But the black cummin is beaten out with a stick,
And the cummin with a rod.
Therefore he does not thresh it forever,

verses.text: “Woe to Ariel, to Ariel, the city where David dwelt!Add year to year;Let feasts come around.

And it shall be to Me as Ariel.

And the mountains shall be melted with their blood.
All the host of heaven shall be dissolved,
And the heavens shall be rolled up like a scroll;
All their host shall fall down
As the leaf falls from the vine,
“For My sword shall be bathed in heaven;
Indeed it shall come down on Edom,
And on the people of My curse, for judgment.
With the blood of lambs and goats,
With the fat of the kidneys of rams.
And a great slaughter in the land of Edom.
The wild oxen shall come down with them,
And the young bulls with the mighty bulls;
Their land shall be soaked with blood,
The year of recompense for the cause of Zion.
Its streams shall be turned into pitch,
Its land shall become burning pitch.
It shall not be quenched night or day;
From generation to generation it shall lie waste;
No one shall pass through it forever and ever.
Also the owl and the raven shall dwell in it.
And He shall stretch out over it
The line of confusion and the stones of emptiness.
They shall call its nobles to the kingdom,
there, and all its princes shall be nothing.
And thorns shall come up in its palaces,
Nettles and brambles in its fortresses;
It shall be a habitation of jackals,
The wild beasts of the desert shall also meet with the
And the wild goat shall bleat to its companion;
the night creature shall rest there,
And find for herself a place of rest.
There the arrow snake shall make her nest and lay
There also shall the hawks be gathered,
Not one of these shall fail;
Not one shall lack her mate.
For My mouth has commanded it, and His Spirit has gathered them.
He has cast the lot for them,
And His hand has divided it among them with a measuring line.
From generation to generation they shall dwell in it.”

verse_parts.text: Then Isaiah the son of Amoz sent to Hezekiah, saying, “Thus says the
God of Israel, ‘Because you have prayed to Me against Sennacherib king of Assyria,
has spoken concerning him:“The virgin, the daughter of Zion,
Has despised you, laughed you to scorn;
And lifted up your eyes on high?
Against the Holy One of Israel.
By your servants you have reproached the Lord,
And said, ‘By the multitude of my chariots
I have come up to the height of the mountains,
I will cut down its tall cedars
I will enter its farthest height,
I have dug and drunk water,
And with the soles of my feet I have dried up
From ancient times that I formed it?
Now I have brought it to pass,
Your going out and your coming in,
Because your rage against Me and your tumult
Have come up to My ears,
Therefore I will put My hook in your nose
And My bridle in your lips,
And I will turn you back
By the way which you came.” ’
a sign to you:You shall eat this year such as grows of itself,
And the second year what springs from the same;
Also in the third year sow and reap,
Plant vineyards and eat the fruit of them.
And the remnant who have escaped of the house of Judah
For out of Jerusalem shall go a remnant,
And those who escape from Mount Zion.
concerning the king of Assyria:‘He shall not come into this city,
Nor come before it with shield,
Nor build a siege mound against it.
By the way that he came,
By the same shall he return;
And he shall not come into this city,’
‘For I will defend this city, to save it
For My own sake and for My servant David’s sake.’ ”
killed in the camp of the Assyrians one hundred and eighty-five thousand; and when
arose early in the morning, there were the corpses—all dead.
So Sennacherib king of Assyria departed and went away, returned

Now it came to pass, as he was worshiping in the house of Nisroch his god, that his sons Adrammelech and Sharezer struck him down with the sword; and they escaped into the land of Ararat. Then Esarhaddon his son reigned in his place.

verses.text: Indeed they are all worthless;Their works are nothing;Their molded images are wind and confusion.

verse_parts.text: Let them come near, then let them speak;

he had not gone with his feet?

your God, will hold your right hand,

the God of Israel, will not forsake them.

I will plant in the wilderness the cedar and the acacia tree,
The myrtle and the oil tree;
I will set in the desert the cypress tree
That they may see and know,
And the Holy One of Israel has created it.

For I will pour water on him who is thirsty,
And floods on the dry ground;
I will pour My Spirit on your descendants,
And My blessing on your offspring;
They will spring up among the grass
And who can proclaim as I do?
Then let him declare it and set it in order for Me,
Since I appointed the ancient people.
And the things that are coming and shall come,
Let them show these to them.
Do not fear, nor be afraid;
Have I not told you from that time, and declared
Is there a God besides Me?
Those who make an image, all of them
And their precious things shall not profit;
They neither see nor know, that they may be ashamed.
Who would form a god or mold an image
Surely all his companions would be ashamed;
Let them all be gathered together,
The blacksmith with the tongs works one in the coals,
And works it with the strength of his arms.
Even so, he is hungry, and his strength fails;
He drinks no water and is faint.
He marks one out with chalk;
He fashions it with a plane,
He marks it out with the compass,
And makes it like the figure of a man,
According to the beauty of a man, that it may remain in the house.
He cuts down cedars for himself,
And takes the cypress and the oak;
for himself among the trees of the forest.
He plants a pine, and the rain nourishes
Then it shall be for a man to burn,
For he will take some of it and warm himself;
Indeed he makes a god and worships
He makes it a carved image, and falls down to it.
He burns half of it in the fire;
With this half he eats meat;
He roasts a roast, and is satisfied.
And the rest of it he makes into a god,
He falls down before it and worships
They do not know nor understand;
shut their eyes, so that they cannot see,
their hearts, so that they cannot understand.
And no one considers in his heart,
“I have burned half of it in the fire,
Yes, I have also baked bread on its coals;
I have roasted meat and eaten
And shall I make the rest of it an abomination?
Shall I fall down before a block of wood?”
A deceived heart has turned him aside;
And he cannot deliver his soul,
not a lie in my right hand?”
O Israel, you will not be forgotten by Me!
I have blotted out, like a thick cloud, your transgressions,
And like a cloud, your sins.
Return to Me, for I have redeemed you.”
Shout, you lower parts of the earth;
Break forth into singing, you mountains,
O forest, and every tree in it!
And He who formed you from the womb:
Who spreads abroad the earth by Myself;
Who frustrates the signs of the babblers,
Who confirms the word of His servant,
And performs the counsel of His messengers;
Who says to Jerusalem, ‘You shall be inhabited,’
To the cities of Judah, ‘You shall be built,’
And I will raise up her waste places;
Who says to the deep, ‘Be dry!
And I will dry up your rivers’;
And he shall perform all My pleasure,
Saying to Jerusalem, “You shall be built,”
And to the temple, “Your foundation shall be laid.” ’

content_parts.text: —According to both Jewish and Christian tradition, Isaiah the son of Amoz is the author of this book.
Isaiah, which means “the salvation of God,” was from the tribe of Judah and was the nephew of King Amaziah (796–767 BC) of Judah.
He is commemorated on May 9.

—The time period is mentioned as “in the days of Uzziah, Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah, kings of Judah.” This places the book about 745–680 BC, from approximately 25 years before the Assyrian captivity of the Northern Kingdom to about 40 years after it.
“The Holy One of Israel” (1:4), who punishes His unrepentant people but later will redeem them.
“The Holy One of Israel” (
), who punishes His unrepentant people but later will redeem them.
The prophet's vision of the glory of God (
1:6ff
) is one of infinite transcendence.
Man's role is one of faith in response to God's holiness and vision for the world.
Isaiah revealed the Messiah in amazing detail—as if he were telling history instead of the future.
He even describes the Theotokos (ch.
) and how she is to conceive and bear God the Son incarnate with her virginity intact.
Isaiah describes the suffering of Christ (ch.
) together with His Resurrection from the dead, proclaiming His kingdom as if it had already happened.
—Assyria was growing in power under Tiglath-Pileser, who turned to the west after his conquests to the east.
He saw the kingdom of Israel fall to Assyria's might along with other nations along the Mediterranean coast.
Seeing his people taken captive, Isaiah turned to warn the Southern Kingdom of Judah to trust in God alone.
